decks.notes: This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Doomsday followed by Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck includes a variety of cantrips and tutors to find and set up the combo quickly, along with disruption like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo. It also includes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to generate card advantage and further help set up the combo. The land base is optimized for consistency and includes cards like Necropotence to fuel the combo even further.

This deck focuses on utilizing Coveted Jewel and various mana-producing artifacts to generate mana quickly and efficiently. By assembling the necessary pieces, the deck aims to create a powerful engine that can generate massive amounts of mana and draw cards with Paradoxical Outcome. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and other counterspells to protect its combo pieces. The ultimate goal is to ramp into powerful plays, such as casting multiple spells in a single turn or accessing powerful artifacts like The One Ring and Time Vault.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Coveted Jewel combo utilizing various mana acceleration cards and tutors such as Tinker. By generating large amounts of mana with cards like Grim Monolith and Sol Ring, the deck aims to play the Coveted Jewel and use Paradoxical Outcome to draw into more combo pieces and disrupt the opponent with Force of Will and Sink into Stupor. The deck also includes versatile artifacts like The One Ring and Karn, the Great Creator to further enhance its combo potential and control the game.

The deck focuses on quickly getting out Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures into play, while disrupting opponent's strategy with counterspells and hand disruption. It also has access to powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns for additional control. The deck utilizes a mix of fast mana and card draw spells to set up its game plan efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through powerful creatures and disruptive spells, making it difficult for the opponent to execute their own strategy effectively.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifact synergies and combo pieces to create a powerful win condition. By using cards like Time Vault and Manifold Key, the deck aims to take extra turns and control the game. The inclusion of Transmute Artifact and Tinker allows for quick access to key combo pieces, while cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation provide protection against opposing threats. The deck also includes various mana accelerants such as the Moxen and Sol Ring to help ramp into its game-winning plays.

This deck focuses on using a combination of efficient card draw, counterspells, and powerful tutors to set up a winning Doomsday combo. By carefully manipulating your library and graveyard with cards like Thassa's Oracle and Doomsday, you can execute a game-winning play that relies on precise sequencing and resource management. The deck is designed to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to either win the game outright or disrupt your opponent's plans while setting up your own win condition. It requires careful planning and strategic thinking to maximize its full potential.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies with counterspells and removal spells, while also using card advantage and incremental advantage through card draw and tutoring to maintain control of the game. It utilizes powerful vintage restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Black Lotus along with the synergistic play of Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Orcish Bowmasters to limit opponent's options. The inclusion of a companion in Lurrus of the Dream-Den adds resiliency and flexibility to the deck's game plan, making it a formidable control archetype in Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures onto the battlefield, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Hullbreaker Horror. It also utilizes various control elements like Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Swan Song to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation with cards like Brainstorm, Ancestral Recall, and Gitaxian Probe. Additionally, it has some lockdown potential with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Oko, Thief of Crowns. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while ramping into powerful threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It aims to control the board with cards like Deathrite Shaman and Collector Ouphe, while also utilizing removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. The deck also includes disruptive counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its own game plan. It has a versatile mix of cards that allow it to adapt to different situations and maintain a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with dredge cards like Golgari Thug and Stinkweed Imp to recur creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam. Using cards like Noxious Revival and Serum Powder to enable the graveyard synergies, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of creatures and disruptive spells like Force of Will and Mental Misstep. The deck also utilizes cards like Creeping Chill and Silversmote Ghoul to drain opponent's life points, while utilizing Bazaar of Baghdad for card selection and advantage.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 combo deck focuses on utilizing powerful artifacts and spells to create explosive turns and generate significant card advantage through cards like Paradoxical Outcome. The deck aims to manipulate the battlefield and control the opponent's moves with cards like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Force of Will while setting up combos with cards like Time Vault and Manifold Key. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional versatility and resilience to the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly using artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen, along with cards like Mana Crypt and Sol Ring. It then uses the card Paradoxical Outcome to bounce these artifacts back to hand and draw more cards, allowing for explosive plays. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and protection in the form of Swords to Plowshares. It aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

The deck focuses on generating a lot of mana quickly using artifact acceleration like Moxen and Mana Vault, along with card draw from Sensei's Divining Top and Paradoxical Outcome. The key win condition is to assemble the Time Vault and Voltaic Key combo to take extra turns. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to establish a dominating board presence and outpace the opponent with efficient combos and powerful artifact synergies.

This deck focuses on using various ways to quickly get powerful creatures into the graveyard and then bring them back into play with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also using disruptive spells like Force of Will and Fatal Push to control the game. The deck also includes some card draw and disruption to help find combo pieces and protect the reanimated creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to take advantage of the Paradoxical Outcome card in order to generate significant card advantage and mana acceleration. By utilizing powerful artifacts such as Mana Vault, Black Lotus, and Moxen, along with cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Tinker, the deck aims to create a loop of bouncing artifacts back to hand while also drawing cards with cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Narset, Parter of Veils. This combo-centric approach allows the deck to quickly ramp up and overwhelm opponents in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 combo deck revolves around using Phyrexian Dreadnought as a powerful threat, supported by various control elements to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional consistency and recursion to the deck. The deck aims to assemble the Dreadnought combo quickly while also controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan effectively. The versatile nature of the deck allows for adaptability in different matchups, making it a strong contender in the format.
